intro: Peltobryon guilleminianum, commonly known as the Guilleminian moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Pterobryaceae. It is characterized by its small, leafy shoots and is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. The plant has a simple, acrocarpous growth form, with capsules that are often clustered at the tips of the stems. Its leaves are usually elongated and have a distinct midrib, contributing to its overall appearance. This moss plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various microorganisms in its ecosystem.
